newsitem.title: USA: Riddell Sports extends Varsity tender offer.
newsitem.headline: Riddell Sports extends Varsity tender offer.

text.p: Sporting goods maker Riddell Sports Inc. said Monday it has extended its $18.90 per share tender offer for all outstanding common shares of Varsity Spirit Corp. to June 17.
The $91 million tender offer, announced last month, had been due to expire Tuesday.
As of June 6, New York-based Riddell said it had bought about 3.25 million shares, or 71.2 percent of Varsity's outstanding shares.
The extension will give Riddell additional time to complete the private placement financing to be used to fund the purchase of Varsity shares in the offer, it said.
Varsity, based in Memphis, Tenn., makes cheerleading and dance uniforms and had revenues of about $90 million last year.
Riddell is best known as a maker of football equipment.
Varsity's stock rose 12.5 cents to $18.875 on Nasdaq shortly before midday. Riddell last traded at $4.75 on Nasdaq on Friday.
